channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Donald Trump suspends immigration into US for 60 days, Australian death toll stands at 74 as global COVID-19 cases exceed 2.5 million

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: parliament sits to consider emergency laws

item.description: Worldwide cases pass 2.5m mark amid disappointing small-scale tests on hydroxychloroquine drug.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: The world's first Environmental Protection Agency EPA was formed in 1970, exactly 50 years ago. Fifty years on Queensland remains the only Australian state without an independent EPA.
item.title: 'What century is Queensland in?' environmentalist asks over EPA

item.description: St Vincent's Hospital opens a Covid-19 test in Darlinghurst, East Sydney.
item.title: Covid-19 clinic opens in East Sydney

item.description: The transformation of "black gold" into a liability heralds a new round of deflation and financial destruction as the COVID-19 pandemic wrecks the world economy, some market participants believe.
item.title: Oil price collapse spells doom for all other assets, bears warn

item.description: Novak Djokovic has reiterated he is against taking an coronavirus vaccination if it becomes mandatory to travel once the pandemic subsides, but says he's open to changing his mind.
item.title: Djokovic reiterates anti-vax stance, but may reconsider

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: Bondi Beach is set to allow limited access to the beach for surfers and swimmers for the purposes of exercise only from Tuesday.
item.title: Bondi to open for swimmers, surfers next week

item.description: New Jersey, Pennsylvania and Michigan each reported their highest single-day coronavirus-related death tolls on Tuesday - over 800 between the three states.
item.title: Coronavirus deaths in the US top 45,000, doubling in a week

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Police are ramping up their public appeal for information about missing campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay, who disappeared in the high country a month ago.
item.title: 'We are deeply saddened': Families of missing campers ask for public help

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: A cyclist has been hit and killed by a truck in Lalor in the early hours of the morning, while a 46-year-old man fights for life after a hit-run in Dandenong on Tuesday.
item.title: Cyclist killed by truck, as another fights for life after hit-run

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: There have been two more deaths in NSW from coronavirus and five new COVID-19 infections confirmed in the state. It comes as the embattled Ruby Princess cruise ship is expected to leave Australian waters on Thursday.
item.title: NSW records two more coronavirus deaths, bringing national toll to 74

item.dc:creator: Mex Cooper
item.description: Australians are losing loved ones, businesses, jobs and sleep as the coronavirus pandemic takes its toll on our community. Readers have shared their hardships.
item.title: Readers share the pain of this pandemic

item.dc:creator: Mex Cooper
item.description: We're asking readers to share their best tips for getting through the coronavirus crisis.Â
item.title: Readers share their tips on how to cope with life under lockdown

item.dc:creator: Mex Cooper
item.description: Life in lockdown for many of our readers has meant a slower pace, time with family, and small surprises and new experiences that have brought unexpected joy.
item.title: Readers find silver linings to life in lockdown

item.dc:creator: Mex Cooper
item.description: Time in lockdown can seem like the perfect excuse to comfort eat chocolate and catch up on TV shows, but it's important we all keep moving if we want to avoid emerging from our homes dressed in muumuus.
item.title: How our readers are keeping fit and healthy

item.dc:creator: Mex Cooper
item.description: From bike rides, to FaceTime and restricted screen time ... here's how parents are keeping their kids occupied.
item.title: Readers share their tips on coping with kids at home

item.description: The annual push for public awareness on the environment comes amid a pandemic, prompting activists to demand action online.
item.title: Earth Day in lockdown: A chance to imagine a different future

item.description: The 2014 Anzac Day clash was a game of momentum. After Essendon jumped out to an early 37-point lead, Collingwood kicked the next nine goals to eventually win by 23 points.
item.title: From the Archives, 2014: Magpies storm back to win Anzac Day clash

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: WA Health Director General David Russell-Weisz the state would see an incremental and soft return to elective surgery as a balance would need to be struck between surgery and keeping resources available.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Elective surgeries back as WA's infections remain low

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: WA has a new set of residential and commercial tenancy laws put in place while the government attempts to arrest the economic fallout of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: What WA's new tenancy laws mean for renters, landlords and tenants

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: A group of Perth councils has called on the federal government to triple its assistance grants to local governments.
item.title: WA councils call for extra $5 billion in federal funds to handle COVID-19 fallout

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX to open lower after oil price collapse spooks Wall Street

item.description: Former New England Patriots tight end turned wrestler Rob Gronkowski is set to join his former teammate Tom Brady at the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
item.title: 'I'm not totally done': Gronkowski pulls pin to reunite with Brady

item.description: Speaking at a webcast event, Cui Tiankai also defended the handling of the disease by China, which has drawn fire from Trump.
item.title: Chinese envoy takes veiled swipe at Trump for politicising coronavirus

item.description: English umpire Ian Gould told the BBC he was also taken aback by the emotional press conferences conducted by Steve Smith and Cameron Bancroft in Australia.
item.title: 'I think the public had had enough': umpire shocked by sandpaper bans

item.description: Ten of the world's largest banks, including JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America, have been sued for allegedly conspiring over nearly 14 years to rig prices in the $15.3 trillion US corporate bond market, costing ordinary investors billions of dollars.
item.title: Global bank giants rigged US corporate bond market for years, lawsuit claims

item.description: The streaming giant won more paid subscribers than expected in the first quarter as global lockdowns to curb the spread of the coronavirus forced people to stay at home and watch shows online including its wildly popular "Tiger King."
item.title: Netflix subscriber numbers jump in coronavirus lockdown

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The 35-year-old victim was rushed his to hospital, where he was later declared dead.
item.title: Man killed in Gold Coast stabbing, police launch homicide investigation

item.description: The billionaire told staff he plans to "raise as much money against the island as possible" after his unsuccessful pleas for government bailouts of Virgin Australia and Virgin Atlantic.
item.title: Richard Branson turns to his Caribbean island to save Virgin empire

item.description: Researchers did not track side effects, but noted a hint that hydroxychloroquine might have damaged other organs, too.
item.title: Coronavirus study shows more deaths, no benefit from Trump's drug treatment suggestion

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: The NRL is set to settle for less than the annual $325 million in broadcast revenue to ensure the financial viability of the sport's future.
item.title: NRL moves closer to three-year broadcast extension with Nine and Fox

item.description: Lawsuits against other countries are typically fruitless because US law generally prohibits them with rare exceptions, said one international law expert.
item.title: US state of Missouri sues China over coronavirus pandemic

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: As winter fades and spring breaks over Sweden, a high-stakes experiment in self-responsibility is underway.
item.title: A disaster waiting to happen or a bold, evidence-based response? In Sweden, it depends who you ask

item.description: Equity investors have become wary of the extent of the economic damage from sweeping lockdown measures that have halted business activity and sparked millions of layoffs.
item.title: Wall Street tumbles as oil crash adds to pandemic fears

item.description: All available evidence suggests the novel coronavirus originated in animals in China and was not manipulated or produced in a laboratory, the WHO says.
item.title: Coronavirus likely of animal origin, not made in a lab: WHO

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Wednesday, April 22

item.description: Follow our live coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Victoria considered bailing out Virgin Australia and moving its headquarters to Avalon Airport as 10 potential bidders circle the collapsed airline.
item.title: Victoria considered Virgin rescue bid as 10 suitors circle the airline

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Companies that sharply increase debt levels are more likely to put their staff at risk by cutting corners, a study has found.
item.title: Risky business: Sharp debt increases can hit worker safety, study finds

item.description: Getting support will protect Australian consumers at a low cost, relative to the cost of a substantial loss in competition if Virgin fails.
item.title: The government should bail out Virgin, or consumers will suffer

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the week ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, April 22

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: From throat swab to high-tech lab and back again in under 24 hours. This is COVID-19 testing in Sydney.
item.title: Inside a COVID-19 test lab, where negative results are positive news

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: Every Sydneysider will be tested and retested for coronavirus before the pandemic abates, as rapid and widespread detection emerges as a crucial factor for easing restrictions.
item.title: NSW Health says COVID-19 testing for anyone is inevitable

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: One of the country's biggest wealth managers MLC says it would consider investing superannuation money in collapsed airline Virgin Australia.
item.title: MLC chief won't rule out investing in Virgin

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: "We are up for a fight," one bondholder says, adding how they are treated could throw a spanner in the works for the planned restructure.
item.title: Virgin's bond-holders could be a $1.8 billion thorn in restructure

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: It's far from perfect, but Airtree Ventures partner James Cameron says the government's proposed COVID-19 contact tracing app doesn't pose a dire risk to privacy.
item.title: Local tech leaders say contact tracing app will save lives

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Frasers Property Industrial has expanded its tenant base at the Horsley Park estate.
item.title: Frasers secures long-term lease with truck maker Hino

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: GPT Group and Australian Office Unity fund have defied current market jitters with expansion into the western Sydney office sector.
item.title: Office space expands in bustling Parramatta despite market jitters

item.description: The May 11 start date is one certainty in a sea of uncertainty.
item.title: Return to class is going to look very different from school to school
